instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots in SMC Bypass mode, restarts with high fans
threads.message:
It seemed like everything was working ok with this board but after it was powered off, it wouldn't power back on except with SMC Bypass. Restarting equals high fans and keyboard backlight is off. Occasionally I could get it to start normal but not shut down and power back up afterward. If I shut down, the power button won't turn it back on. Can still do SMC Reset so power button is still working when it won't turn on. Plugging in without holding power button down acts like it is in SMC bypass as well. I tested holding down shift, control, option keys to see if light would change without power button but no, so it doesn't appear the power button is stuck on.

Tried reflowing then replacing SMC. Same symptoms.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots in SMC Bypass mode, restarts with high fans
threads.message:
Start in diagbistic mode.
If possible to get into macOS, run HWMonitor and look for strange values.

Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots in SMC Bypass mode, restarts with high fans
threads.message:
SMC DCIN VSENSE is 2.2V
/PBUS VSENSE is 1.4V
Will check diag.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots in SMC Bypass mode, restarts with high fans
threads.message:
diagnostics:
trackpad issue: NDR001
Power mgt: PPN001
SMC: PFM006
also reference; VDH002 & NDK001

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots in SMC Bypass mode, restarts with high fans
threads.message:
"SMC DCIN VSENSE is 2.2V"
Original Magsafe 2 charger?
There should be higher value.

Try the board alone whithout trackpad connected; it should start automatically, when charger is plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots in SMC Bypass mode, restarts with high fans
threads.message: Ended up replacing the trackpad cable which resolved the power button not working at times. Replacing the SMC AGAIN oy fixed the high fan problem. As always... thanks for your help! pointing me toward the diagnostic and asking about the trackpad cable sent me down a road I wouldn't have guessed. I believe the trackpad cable was originally the only problem but having replaced the SMC I caused another either with a bad SMC or bad replacement job. *sigh*
